definition: having ample food and clothing (idiom); well fed and clothed

sentences.english: Is happy life not only have ample food and clothing, also lies in the clear water, blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 幸福生活不只在於豐衣足食，也在於碧水藍天。

sentences.english: If the Chinese are content for being fed, why ask for a change, in whatever name?
sentences.chinese: 如果中國人豐衣足食，那需要以什麼名義來變革？

sentences.english: Jiao Zi looks like gold coin, implying a wealthy year ahead.
sentences.chinese: 餃子看起來像金元寶，意味來年豐衣足食。

sentences.english: Massage whole or in part by the United Nations and clothing.
sentences.chinese: 按摩可全部或部分受聯合國豐衣足食。

sentences.english: We will became self-sufficient in food and clothing by producing them ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我們用自己動手的方法，達到豐衣足食的目的。

sentences.english: Now people have enough to eat and wear.
Some people live in plenty , while others haven ' t enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 一些人過着豐衣足食的生活，而另一些人卻喫不飽。

definition: When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
thriving and prosperous business or trade
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
after one's heart (idiom); gratifying and satisfactory/everything one could wish
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
to be successful in business/professional success
to force someone to do something
